author: By Emma Munbodh
title: Tripadvisor how-to: 6 tips to find cheap flights, best-value hotels and reviews
text:
Tripadvisor, one of the biggest travel websites in the world, is famously used by holiday-makers and travellers in search of inspiration, help and advice.
The website is renowned for its reviews, on everything from restaurants to destinations, but do a little digging, and you'll also find cheap deals on hotels, flights and holiday rentals.
Read on for our thrifty guide on how make the most of Tripadvisor .
For more information on cheap holidays, pin our cheap travel page for up-to-the-minute airline sales and travel news.
1. Find airline sales and glitches in their Bargain Forum Tripadvisor has a Bargain Travel Forum with publicly-shared information on sales, glitches, and tips on how to book a holiday.
The forum also offers advice on where not to go and airlines to avoid. If you want to make a complaint, or find out if others have had the same problem as you, here's where you should look.
2. Compare prices on hotels to cheapest deal The website is known for its honest reviews on where to go from fellow travellers, but it's not just about the 5-star hotels.
The hotel price guide lets you compare hotel prices in real time - so you can find the cheapest deal going for your destination and
3. Find cheap flights using their low fare finder Tripadvisor's Cheap Flights widget allows holidaymakers to input their destination and date of travel to find the cheapest flights available around that period - across a number of the popular airlines.
There's also the option to compare prices with other big travel retailers including Expedia and ebookers - so you can make sure you're flight is the cheapest one going.
4. See the top 25 hotels in your area and compare prices Need hotel inspiration? Tripadvisor has a top 25 hotels for every city in the world - so if you're really stuck for choice, it's a handy and reliable place to start.
You can also narrow this down to 25 romantic hotels and 25 luxury hotels, so you can compare prices based the type of holiday you're after.
5. Get the best deals using their Bargain Hotels finder On a really tight budget? The website has a top 25 bargain hotels guide which offers reviews and images for the best-value hotels in every destination.
This can also be narrowed down to best-service hotels and family accomodation .
6. See 'today's lowest fares from London' for late deals Travelling last minute? The travel website has a list of the cheapest last minute flights from London on the right hand side of the cheap flights page.
All prices are return fares, and are updated every 72-hours.
